Abstract Algebra | The Second Isomorphism Theorem for Rings

Second isomoriohism theorem\nIf [imath] R [/imath] is a ring, where [imath] S \subset R [/imath] is a subring and [imath] I \subset R [/imath] is an ideal, then\n[imath] S+I \subset R [/imath] is a subring\n[imath] S \cap I \subset S [/imath] is an ideal\n[imath] (S+I) / I \cong S /(S \cap I) [/imath]
